facts.description: The Moon is Earth's only permanent natural satellite
The Moon always shows Earth the same face. The Moon is in synchronous rotation with Earth.
The Moon’s surface is actually dark. Although compared to the night sky it appears very bright
The Moon is drifting away from the Earth. The Moon is moving approximately 3.8 cm away from our planet every year.
The Moon was made when a rock smashed into Earth
The Moon makes the Earth move as well as the tides
The Moon has quakes too. They're not called earthquakes but moonquakes.
There is water on the Moon! This is in the form of ice trapped within dust and minerals on and under the surface.
A person would weigh much less on the Moon.
The Moon has only been walked on by 12 people; all American men.
The first spacecraft to reach the Moon was Luna 1 in 1959.
During the 1950’s the USA considered detonating a nuclear bomb on the Moon.
The moon is about the same age as earth.
The moon orbits the Earth at an average speed of 2,300 miles an hour (3,700 kilometers an hour).
The Moon’s entire surface is cratered and pitted from impacts.
